Name: Battle for Biternia: Pixelvania
Description:
Venture into a gloomy new territory with Pixelvania, an exciting new Hero Pack that expands the base set of Battle for Biternia with a roster of fun and foreboding new Heroes and effects which are fully compatible with your existing collection. Drawing inspiration from Castleviania, Ghosts & Goblins, and other classics, Pixelvania seeks out the things that go bump in the night...and the brave souls who wish to slay them.

Can you protect the Four Nations from this new threat? Or will you help bring the curse of Pixelvania to Biternia’s mainland? The choice is yours!

—description from the publisher
Families: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

Name: Marvel Champions: The Card Game – Venom Hero Pack
Description:
A wartime veteran and an old classmate of Peter Parker, Flash Thompson was fused with the Venom symbiote during Project Rebirth 2.0, the U.S. government’s second super-soldier program. Now, Venom travels the galaxy, using his exceptional abilities to take down the forces of evil wherever they may be.

As another member of the Guardians of the Galaxy, Venom swings into action in this expansion pack, which introduces Venom as a brand-new playable hero along with his fifteen signature cards. With a pre-built Justice deck ready to go from the moment you open the box, you’ll be able to try out Venom’s impressive arsenal right away. Rush in guns blazing and tear your way through the villain’s schemes with this high-powered hero!

-description from publisher's website
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Marvel Champions – The Card Game

Name: Instant Propose: Trash Girl Expansion
Description:
For you who are beyond saving.

The Word Expansion for "Instant Propose". Only for Korean.
Invention! Trash Girl(Youtuber) is carefully selected, and KIMKUN(Underdog Games) is only slightly seasoned.
There are 86 Word Cards with a trashy atmosphere.

Name: Green Hell: The Board Game
Description:
Green Hell: The Board Game is a non-legacy, campaign, survival, fully cooperative game for 1-4 players. The board game follows the recipe for success implemented by its electronic counterpart, by introducing a highly optimizable set of survival mechanics, pitting players against a changeable and unpredictable jungle environment. The core mechanics of the game are:

Players are all members of a search and rescue party, sent into the Amazon rainforest to locate Jake Higgins - the protagonist known from the computer game. Avoiding too many spoilers, the plot of the board game campaign runs its own course and uses some hallmark elements of the overarching Green Hell story, without spoiling the electronic adventure to anyone.

Apart from the characters in the team - who have varying roles and asymmetric skills (the Survival Expert, the Guide, the Medic, the Scientist) the other main character of the game is the jungle itself. With a map based on random card setup, providing modularity (no two games of the same scenario will look the same), and an ever-expanding area to cover (each scenario will allow players to uncover a part of a greater region, and sometimes the players will have to backtrack to an already known location) the jungle creation system introduces variability and unpredictability to each session.

–description from the designer

Name: Mythic Battles: Ragnarök – Asgard
Description:
Asgard, Kingdom of the Gods centered around an impregnable fortress, built by the hand of the Master Builder, a giant whom the Gods betrayed, whose blood mixed cement held together the walls.
Now it is these very foundations that give way under assault. Odin and Heimdall are not on Midgard. The prophecy lied.
Has Odin fled his fate? Heimdall? What good would the defense and survival of Asgard do if the other worlds perished?
Find out in these superb expansion Adventure Mode Scenarios.

Includes:
1 Double-sided Board
15 Miniatures
8 Dashboards
31 Activation Cards
2 Troop Cards
2 Jarl Attachment Cards
6 Adventure Mode Scenarios (2 mini-campaigns)

Name: フィギュアクイーン (Figure Queen)
Description:
The trick-taking game ãƒ•ã‚£ã‚®ãƒ¥ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚¤ãƒ¼ãƒ³ (Figure Queen) was released as part of the publisher ruri ruri games' (ã‚‹ã‚Šã‚‹ã‚Šã‚²ãƒ¼ãƒ ã‚º) Spring 2019 box of trick-taking games, titled ãƒˆãƒªãƒ†ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆ4 (Trick Taking Set 4).

In the game, players are judges issuing scores to 5 figure skaters. The cards used in the game have ranks such as 9.50, 7.80, and 5.30, representing scores given to the skaters.  As in an Olympic figure skating competition, the highest and lowest scores are omitted, and the other scores issued are averaged to evaluate the skater's performance.

Players bid on which skater they think will perform best over two rounds.  The person who most accurately predicts the highest scoring skater will win!

Name: You Are Probably the Criminal
Description:
In You Are Probably the Criminal, a.k.a. ã‚ãªãŸãŒãŸã¶ã‚“çŠ¯äººã§ã™, you and the other players are suspects in a murder case. Heartless as it might sound, who is actually guilty of the crime doesn't matter because in the end all that matters is who is the most suspicious among you!

The criminal search relies on four elements — weapon, motive, place, time — and evidence cards left by the actual criminal is placed face down in the center of the table. Each player also receives a confession card for each of these four elements, and sometimes a confession card will match the evidence card.

On your turn, you can make a statement based on the confession cards you hold or you can investigate an evidence card by revealing a confession card you hold. If you make a statement that matches the evidence, you'll be more suspicious, so you might prefer to investigate — but the fewer statements you make, the more suspicion points you gain at turn's end, so you can't only investigate. Perhaps you can forge evidence to throw off suspicion?

In the end, the player with the most suspicion points loses the game and is arrested.

Name: Cuestión de Honor: Annual 1921
Description:
Grand-tactical level game of the 1921 campaign in the Rif. The retreat from the Annual encampment in 1921. 
750 meters /hex, Company level units.

Published in Alea Magazine #36 (April 2021)

Note: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Annual

Name: Wilderness Dice: Bring Your Own Dice
Description:
Wilderness Dice is back! This time as a ‘Bring Your Own Dice’ edition. This version shares all the classic gameplay of Wilderness Dice, but comes without the 12x 6-sided dice. Being the most common type of dice, it’s our hope that players will be able to go into their collection and snag some dice to play with.

Players who are concerned about having enough dice on hand, we have a 12-pack of dice available.

Wilderness Dice pits two players in a battle to claim dice before their opponent. Each player has a single action to either claim a die or modify it. Players must carefully decide when to modify dice, and when to claim them. Players may also sacrifice dice, keeping any player from claiming them.

The game is played in a series of three rounds. The round ends when there are no more dice to claim, either because players claimed them all – or some have been discarded. Each round players refill their hand back up to six cards, meaning any remaining cards in a players hand hang around until they can eventually claim a die to get rid of them.

—description from the designer

Name: Wilderness Dice: BYOD – Exotic Expansion
Description:
Expand Wilderness Dice with this standalone-expansion that adds up to two additional players, or play Wilderness Dice using any combination of animal decks. The key to expanding Wilderness Dice is making sure to include the proper number of dice. For the first two players, add 12 dice. Each additional player should add 3 dice to the total. Players will still only complete three rounds of dice rolls. This does mean that more players will have leftover cards at the end of each round.

The Exotic expansion includes animals from both Australia and Africa. While these animals are arguably only 'exotic' to Western cultures, we felt the name fit the theme of the base game which centers on the North American wilderness.

—description from the designer

Name: Wilderness Dice: BYOD – Ancient Expansion
Description:
Expand Wilderness Dice with this standalone-expansion that adds up to two additional players, or play Wilderness Dice using any combination of animal decks. The key to expanding Wilderness Dice is making sure to include the proper number of dice. For the first two players, add 12 dice. Each additional player should add 3 dice to the total. Players will still only complete three rounds of dice rolls. This does mean that more players will have leftover cards at the end of each round.

The Ancient expansion includes both Dinosaurs and Cryptids. Naming the set was difficult, and ultimately is named in honor of the two animals being vastly older than any other animal in Wilderness Dice (if cryptids actually existed, they’d surely be old). We hope that players choose these decks because they are fans of dinosaurs or the legendary beasts.

—description from the designer

Name: Wilderness Dice: BYOD – Domestic Expansion
Description:
Expand Wilderness Dice with this standalone-expansion that adds up to two additional players, or play Wilderness Dice using any combination of animal decks. The key to expanding Wilderness Dice is making sure to include the proper number of dice. For the first two players, add 12 dice. Each additional player should add 3 dice to the total. Players will still only complete three rounds of dice rolls. This does mean that more players will have leftover cards at the end of each round.

The Domestic expansion includes both Farm animals and Pets. This collection is meant for players who want to use their favorite pets, or for families with farming roots. We hope that the domestic pack offers a wonderful selection of kids (and parents alike) favorite animals.

—description from the designer

Name: Masters of The Universe: Fields of Eternia The Board Game – Hordak with Horde Wraith
Description:
Fear the Horde! Play as Hordak with the Horde Wraith with this limited edition package which contains:

1 x Hordak with Horde Wraith limited edition figure
1 x Game card

No glue required to assemble.
Item is available in Europe only.

-description from publisher's website
Families: Game: Masters of the Universe – Fields of Eternia

Name: Fugu Sushi
Description:
In ï¼¦ï½•ï½‡ï½•ã€€ï¼³ï½•ï½“ï½ˆï½‰, the players are sushi chefs rushing to complete the orders of a string of customers.  It is up to the player how many order cards they reveal.

The player then flips a sand-timer and attempts to prepare the requested sushi and place it on a serving tray.  The players must shape the proper amount of rice; use or not use wasabi as requested; and if the customer orders fugu, the player must use the included plastic knifes and stuffed fugu to cut off the tasty bits and omit the poisonous sections!

Once each player has a chance to serve customers, the player who earned the most points in that round earns 2 overall points and the next player earns 1 overall point.  The first player to 5 overall points wins.

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Mr. Sinister
Description:
Once, Nathaniel Essex was a biologist in Victorian London. Realizing that an increasing number of human mutations signaled the beginning of a new evolution, Essex put aside morality in his pursuit of perfecting the human race. A long road of unethical experiments on unwilling subjects eventually led to him to incredible discoveries and even greater personal power. Becoming something far more than human, Nathaniel transformed himself into the nearly-immortal being known as Mister Sinister.

Mister Sinister views the mutant race's eventual dominance over the world as a foregone conclusion, and that now we must look beyond the next step. Believing that certain genetic bloodlines possess greater mutant power than others, Mister Sinister has targeted members of the X-Men as potential experimental subjects. Regardless of the opposition, Mister Sinister will allow nothing to impede his quest for evolutionary perfection.

Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Mr. Sinister includes one miniature, a character stat card, two team tactic cards, and thirteen tokens.

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Sin & Viper
Description:
When the Red Skull sought an heir for his criminal empire, he fathered Sinthea Schmidt. The girl was raised with constant indoctrination of her father's twisted views. Forced to undergo a physical transformation in one of the Red Skull's machines, she was gifted with superhuman powers. With her partner Crossbones and an incarnation of the Serpent Squad by her side, Sin has rampaged across the world, coming into conflict with the Avengers, S.H.I.E.L.D., and the Winter Soldier.

As a child, Ophelia Sarkissian was taken by Hydra and raised by Daniel Whitehall, the mysterious agent known as Kraken. For over two decades, she trained to become one of the organization's most proficient soldiers. Later in life, she abandoned Hydra to become the leader of the serpent Squad mercenaries, where she used her peak physical conditioning, cunning, and ruthlessness to secure her place as a deadly viper in the global underworld.

Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Sin & Viper includes two miniatures, two character stat cards, two team tactic cards, and eight tokens.

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Scarlet Witch & Quicksilver
Description:
The mutant twins Wanda and Pietro Maximoff are powerful beings who have fought on both sides of the mutant divide, as founding members of the Brotherhood of Mutants, and members in the Avengers and X-Men.

The Scarlet Witch's ability to manipulate reality through chaos magic makes her a potent force for change, able to cause unlikely and random events to occur.

Pietro can move and think at unfathomable speeds, moving faster than the speed of thought. Quicksilver's incredible ability makes him one of the fastest mutants alive but has condemned him to live in a world of slow-moving statues incapable of matching his pace. Arrogant to a fault, Quicksilver will stop at nothing to prove himself a worthy successor of his father.

Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Scarlet Witch & Quicksilver includes two miniatures, two character stat cards, four team tactic cards, and thirteen tokens.

Name: Star Wars: Legion – A-A5 Speeder Truck Unit Expansion
Description:
Deploy your troops into the heart of battle with the A-A5 Speeder Truck Unit Expansion for Star Wars: Legion! A frequent sight in the Outer Rim Territories, the A-A5 speeder truck is both rugged and reliable — traits that make it perfect for conversion to a combat transport. Able to be fitted with armor plating and a turret-mounted weapon while possessing ample room for passengers, cargo, or even emergency medical equipment, the versatility of the A-A5 is second to none.

This expansion contains one finely sculpted, unpainted hard plastic A-A5 Speeder Truck miniature, enough for one heavy unit, that can be assembled with its side doors open or closed and outfitted with either a quad laser or a heavy laser retrofit. In addition to these cosmetic customizations, 16 upgrade cards invite players to modify how your A-A5 Speeder Truck operates in battle by adding new pilots, weapons, and comms systems.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars: Legion – LAAT/le Patrol Transport Unit Expansion
Description:
Scour the battlefield with the LAAT/le Patrol Transport Unit Expansion for Star Wars: Legion! First seeing use by Republic police forces during the height of the Clone Wars, this transport is sufficiently armed and armored to contend with criminal enterprises or insurgent cells. Whether dropping clone troopers into urban battlefields or pinning down Rebel soldiers, both the Republic and Empire can use the LAAT/le for both transport and air support.

Within this expansion, players will find everything needed to add a LAAT/le Patrol Transport to their Republic and Imperial armies. The beautifully detailed, unpainted hard plastic miniature can be assembled with either Phase II clone pilots or Imperial TIE pilots, and unit cards for both factions help players fully integrate them into their forces. In addition to these cards, 12 upgrade cards invite players to customize their LAAT/le with unique pilots from both factions as well as ordnance and comms systems.

—description from the publisher

Name: Hiding Hitler
Description:
Hiding Hitler is a turn based card-game with a simple objective. End the game with the Hitler card in your hand or be the player to have eliminated him last.

To achieve this goal, you will use a mixture of Action, Attack, and Instant cards. Action cards provide various utility methods such as drawing cards, stealing cards, or peaking into the deck. Attack cards are how a player attempts to eliminate Hitler. Instant cards are special because they can be played at any time. They can strengthen, weaken, or redirect an attack to another player. A turn consists of unlimited actions, unlimited instants, up to 1 attack and concludes with drawing a card.

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Lord of the Rings – Bite Size
Description:
This Trivial Pursuit Bitesize edition contains 600 questions about The Lord of the Rings, which are a challenge for even the biggest fans of Middle-earth. Take the handy travel wedge with you wherever you go, and use the special playing token in your boxed game at home!

The game does not feature a game board, and thus, there is no roll-and-move mechanic. Instead, players roll the color-coded die, and answers a question matching the color rolled. If a player correctly answers a question, he may "go for a wedge" by answering another question in the same category. If he does so, he keeps that card. If the player answers a question incorrectly, it is the next player's turn. Play ends when a player has collected six cards/correctly answered 12 questions.

Name: Altar Quest: Lurker Pack
Description: This Pack contains 12 new Lurker cards + miniature that were offered during the Fantasy Series 1 Kickstarter by Blacklist Games.

Name: Deal or Death
Description:
Deal or Death is the negotiation-focused social deduction game about corporate absurdity. Haggle and form coalitions in a series of fast-paced negotiations, while facing the constant threat of betrayal. As Executives attempt to secure the support of Shareholders by promising some coveted paperclips, Infiltrators with hidden agendas will do whatever it takes to fulfill their own ambitions. Who can you trust to make you rich?

After players draw their roles, the Executives shall identify themselves while the roles of the remaining players, known as the Board Members, remain hidden. Each Executive then enters a two-minute negotiation with every Board Member, offering Paperclips in exchange for information and support with the hope of closing Deals with Shareholders during the Board Meeting at the end of the game. Shareholders must decide which Executive to side with and close the most lucrative Deal, while Infiltrators disrupt negotiations with their own goals.

While negotiations are occurring, the other players are free to network, strategizing and scheming with each other. Before the Board Meeting begins, Board Members can discover someone else's role through a Disclosure (provided by Shareholder Tokens, Infiltrator Tokens, and VP Stars). Once the Executives finish negotiating with each Board Member, they may negotiate with one player for the second time in the Endgame Negotiations.

In the Board Meeting that follows, Executives and Shareholders shall submit Proposals, outlining the terms that they are committed to. Executives write down which of their Paperclips will go to who, while Shareholders write down their expected payout and which Executive they are supporting. Terms need to match in order for a Deal to close, but Executives may give more Paperclips than what a Shareholder asks for in their Proposal. Once they are done, players will reveal their Proposals and see who has closed Deals and who has won.

-description from publisher

Name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Central Supply Catalog
Description:
Finding the right tool for the right job can mean the difference between making the big score or gasping for air in the black of space. All the hardware the savvy captain needs can be found in the Central Supply Catalog, the fourth Expansion Pack for the Traveller Customizable Card Game.

These 60 cards provide new gear and ship upgrade options designed to support both contact and piracy decks!

Central Supply Catalog is not a standalone product. A Ship Deck is necessary to play the Traveller Customizable Card Game.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Rogue's Gallery
Description:
Life among the stars is not for the faint of heart, but the lure of riches and adventure draw from all walks of life.  Nobles and scoundrels rub shoulders, while saints and sinners make common cause.  On the mains, everyone has an agenda and no one is what they seem.

Rogue’s Gallery is the third Expansion Pack for the Traveller Customizable Card Game.  These 60 cards have a special emphasis on new crew with higher cost and more potent abilities.

This is not a standalone product.  A Ship Deck is necessary to play the Traveller Customizable Card Game.

Name: Monopoly: Crna Gora
Description:
A country of miracles and a treasure chest full of the worlds most wonderful jewels. It is as if the legend is true, that God's bag really did tear apart when he was providing gifts of nature, and beautiful things like the mountains fell out of the sky over Montenegro. 
Geographers say that, although not large, this area in south Europe and the Balkans is unique for its diversity, and was created in ancient times by strong forces of nature. 
Whether created by the forces or not, it has turned into something beautiful, unusual and magnificent! 
If you enjoy spectacular nature, absolute relaxation and recreational activities, Montenegro is a place where you can experience a joyful energy. The country is great fun, providing adrenaline filled adventures and competitive thrills. You can find long and protected sandy beaches, providing thousands of kilometres of hiking and cycling trails as well as fast flowing rivers ideal for rafting and kayaking and superb ski paths.

Key Features

     The world's best family board game brings you another exciting edition
     Choose your favourite token, tour your favourite sites and accumulate fortunes, but watch out for taxes, jail and bankruptcy
     Invest in houses and hotels and trade your way to success

Name: King of the West: The Mavericks
Description:
There’s somethin’ in the town of Backwater that don’t belong. It fills the air with energy, like it feels before a storm. Except this storm ain’t one of wind and rain, but bullets and blood.

King of the West is a weird west themed area control card game. Three different sets of characters will be available at launch. One set can be played as a 2-3 player 18-card area control game, but multiple sets will allow for up to 9 players with the modified rules variant.

For the area control variant setup, nine building cards are randomly played on a 3x3 grid to make up the town. Six buildings are generic locations and the other three are the unique target locations. Since they are played randomly, the location of these target buildings will be different in every game.

Players can take three actions on their turn: Claim a Building, Move, and Shootout! Shootouts are how you remove opponents from the buildings you want. You do this by trying to get into your opponent's head and outthink them using a nuanced rock-paper-scissors combat system.

The game ends when either a player starts their turn controlling all three target locations or they are the only player controlling any buildings in the town.

With multiple sets and a larger player count, your still fighting over buildings, but instead of gaining a new location every turn, you are limited to what you start with. Players can't be eliminated though and when you run out of your buildings, you can steal someone elses. Other than that, combat works in the same way and the winner is the last person (or team!) left with claimed buildings.

—description from the designer


King of the West' card game set 2: The Mavericks, including The Marshall, The Bartender, The Wolf, and their locations.

Name: King of the West: The Banished
Description:
There’s somethin’ in the town of Backwater that don’t belong. It fills the air with energy, like it feels before a storm. Except this storm ain’t one of wind and rain, but bullets and blood.

King of the West is a weird west themed area control card game. Three different sets of characters will be available at launch. One set can be played as a 2-3 player 18-card area control game, but multiple sets will allow for up to 9 players with the modified rules variant.

For the area control variant setup, nine building cards are randomly played on a 3x3 grid to make up the town. Six buildings are generic locations and the other three are the unique target locations. Since they are played randomly, the location of these target buildings will be different in every game.

Players can take three actions on their turn: Claim a Building, Move, and Shootout! Shootouts are how you remove opponents from the buildings you want. You do this by trying to get into your opponent's head and outthink them using a nuanced rock-paper-scissors combat system.

The game ends when either a player starts their turn controlling all three target locations or they are the only player controlling any buildings in the town.

With multiple sets and a larger player count, your still fighting over buildings, but instead of gaining a new location every turn, you are limited to what you start with. Players can't be eliminated though and when you run out of your buildings, you can steal someone elses. Other than that, combat works in the same way and the winner is the last person (or team!) left with claimed buildings.

—description from the designer


King of the West' card game set 3: The Banished, including The Reaper, The Phantom, The Shade, and their locations.

Name: King of the West: Ghost Towns
Description: A free print-and-play hidden roles expansion for King of the West.

Name: Shot Tennis
Description: The board is a tennis court with holes in a grid of 4x6 for each half of the court. Players use small plastic tennis rackets to catapult cones into the court. Points differ by the area of the court the cones fall at, e.g. left and right service box is 5 points.

Name: La planete fantome
Description: Players roll dice and move robots on a circular board divided into sectors. The robot that reaches the planet in the center first wins.

Name: ボードゲーム 千空と文明の灯 (Dr．STONE)
Description:
The players becomes the characters of "Dr. Stone" and cooperates to achieve the purpose of each episode. There are many mysteries and surprises during the game, and you can solve them by combining materials and making equipment to find ways to achieve your goals.

It is a story driven cooperative game that can be enjoyed not only by those who watch the anime or read the manga, but also by those who haven't watched it.

The purpose of the game is to create a "goal item" in each episode within the time limit. In a world that has lost science, casual things doesn't seem to fulfill a purpose. However, with the knowledge of Senku and the cooperation of his friends, there is nothing impossible!

Name: The Whip
Description:
A rather larger board game where players back lead token horses with evenly distributed game counters. One player acts as a banker. Horses are placed at the start of the track and move one square at a time if their particular number is rolled by a dice. The winner is the first to finish the race and the banker pays out on that horse. A player can also back a red or blue finish on the respective colour lanes.

The horse names represent English and Irish thoroughbred racehorses from the turn of the 20th Century. The horses were famous at the time for winning the prestigious races on the English calendar.

Name: Das Labyrinth
Description: The players start at the large space with the arrow. The first player to reach the large space with the black dot wins the game. Direction of movement is determined by a die. The players move 1 space per turn. If a meeple gets on an occupied space, the the first meeple is returned to the starting space.

Name: Karty Dżentelmenów: Epizod Piąty
Description:
Inspired by Cards Against Humanity (and with their blessing) comes Karty DÅ¼entelmenów ("Gentlemen Cards"). This is a polish spin-off of CAH and the cards are dual language (Polish and English).

Episode 5 consists of 220 new cards:

     50 new Black Cards of questions
     160 new White Cards of answers
     10 blank cards (5 black, 5 white) for Your ideas.
     This game is fully compatible with previous editions


About what is the game? Players draw answer cards to their hand. One person draw question card. In secret everybody add their answer and after shuffle everybody votes on the best/funniest/craziest answer card. The person with the higher number of votes wins the round and take the card to his players area as a point. Than everybody fill answer cards, and the winner draws another question card. You can play how long you want, or determine how much point you need to earn to win the game.

—user summary

PrzekaÅ¼ 100zÅ‚ na fundacjÄ™ dla niewidomych dzieci, które i tak tych pieniÄ™dzy nie zobaczÄ…!

Karty DÅ¼entelmenów: Epizod PiÄ…ty to towarzyska gra karciana przeznaczona dla osób lubiÄ…cych czarny humor bez cenzury! W kaÅ¼dej kolejce DÅ¼entelmen zadaje pytanie z Czarnej Karty, a pozostali odpowiadajÄ… za pomocÄ… swojej najzabawniejszej BiaÅ‚ej Karty. To pierwsza w Polsce dwujÄ™zyczna gra tekstowa tego typu, która umoÅ¼liwia wspólnÄ… zabawÄ™ z anglojÄ™zycznymi znajomymi!

PudeÅ‚ko zawiera 220 kart w tym:

     50 nowych Czarnych Kart pytaÅ„
     160 nowych BiaÅ‚ych Kart odpowiedzi
