     PeÅ‚na kompatybilnoÅ›Ä‡ z pozostaÅ‚ymi czÄ™Å›ciami


—description from the publisher

Name: Karty Dżentelmenów: Epizod Szósty
Description:
Inspired by Cards Against Humanity (and with their blessing) comes Karty DÅ¼entelmenów ("Gentlemen Cards"). This is a polish spin-off of CAH and the cards are dual language (Polish and English).

This is the Sixth deck of polish spin-off CAH and the cards are 2 languages (Polish and English). It is playable by itself or can be combined with previous decks.

About what is the game? Players draw answer cards to their hand. One person draw question card. In secret everybody add their answer and after shuffle everybody votes on the best/funniest/craziest answer card. The person with the higher number of votes wins the round and take the card to his players area as a point. Than everybody fill answer cards, and the winner draws another question card. You can play how long you want, or determine how much point you need to earn to win the game.

Name: Generation Y: Anders Leben! Anders Arbeiten! Anders spielen!
Description:
Generation Y is a new social game with a twist - you will use your smartphones and their features as playing field.


     You are playing around the table with your smartphones
     The game arena is online. A messenger-app of your choosing
     Challenge yourself in over 45 tasks
     Knowledge, talent, creativity and humour will bring you victory


Share your experiences and get a viral hit

—description from the publisher

Generation Y ist ein brandneues Gesellschaftsspiel mit einem innovativen Spielprinzip - ihr nutzt euer Smartphone und dessen unzählige Funktionen als elektronisches Spielinstrument.


     Gespielt wird am heimischen Tisch mit eurem Smartphone
     Die Spielarena ist online. Eine beliebige Messenger-App
     In über 45 Aufgaben fordert ihr euch gegenseitig heraus
     Wissen, Talent, Kreativität und Humor bringen euch den Sieg
     Teilt eure Spielerlebnisse und landet einen viralen Hit


—description from the publisher (German)

Name: Porto: Promo Card
Description: During setup, give this card to the last player. On that player's turn, he or she may use this card as a Construction card of any color. When it is used OR if someone builds a roof, pass this card to the next player on the right.

Name: KOTH
Description:
The board is four concentric rings linked by connector lines. Each players place, move, or jump black or white tokens on the intersections. After each move, all connecting tokens are converted to the color of the active token. The game ends when a token is placed at the center of the circle. The player with the most tokens left is the winner.

—user summary

Name: 3 Minutes to Freedom (or Death)
Description:
This is a short card game for 3-8 players that pushes players to speak and interact with each other in unusual ways, to keep the play entertaining.

Players use cards to force a variety of effects on each other. Many of these have conditions (e.g. "Dance like a sheep for 10 seconds. If you don't, you die.") that must be fulfilled to not be eliminated from the game.

The last player remaining is the winner.

Name: New Techno War
Description:
In today's world, where security is a daily challenge and terrorists and serious crime cross borders, having a modern, mobile and flexible army is of paramount importance.

In New Techno War, you will take command of a modern military troop, based on the doctrine of a real army of today, with its equipment, vehicles and real firepower.

In serious scenarios, based on real facts, but also on original and amusing adventures, you will be able to test your tactics to achieve maximum success in a mission.

In order to optimize your chances, this game proposes to introduce into the troops modern technologies, still in test phase, or non-existent. These extensions should allow you to refine or even reinforce your actions. In the basic box, you will already find the new technology of the exoskeleton.

Name: Rome & Roll: Pantheon Promo Card
Description:
A promo card available from the BGG Store, 2021.

Pantheon is a Religious Building card.

Build: Build entirely on a hill. Max 1 per Hill. Gain a God's Favour.

Production: Pay 1 Jewellery or 1 Anvil to gain either 2 Coins, 2 Legacy or 1 Senator.

Name: Galix in München
Description:
Players move on given tracks through the City of Munich to collect 7 different cards on 7 special places. After each move you are asked a question (multiple choice) about Munich. If the answer is correct you earn extra movement. If you meet another player's pawn on the track, you send him back to his starting point.

The Player to be the first on to collect 7 different Cards, wins the game.

Name: SUPPLY LINE
Description:
A one- or two-player card-based wargame.

There is always one common element between adjacent cards, and when you put them together, the connected elements activate each other.

As you collect these cards in your hand, you combine them to form units to fight for the 11 frontline cards of the two armies lined up in one dimension. The cards in your hand, when lined up and tabbed, create attack power and special effects, so they must be "exactly" the same as either the temporary "repel" value, which makes the front line temporarily yours, or the "dominate" value, which gives you complete control of the front line, making it impossible to ever get it back, and which you can use as a new weapon repeatedly.

The elements are divided into four categories: Land, Sea, Air, and Supply. The Army can only attack frontline cards adjacent to their own territory, while the Navy can only attack blue frontline cards with an anchor symbol. Because of the restrictions on the attack range of the army and navy, you can't attack deep into enemy territory very well, so you must first "repel" the middle of the enemy's front line with auxiliary range enhancing effects from the air force and supply operations to convert it into your territory.

The designer notes that the game's cards were inspired by Dobble/Spot-It.

Name: Terra Proxima
Description:
On the verge of extinction, after years of conflict that has left their planet nearly depleted of its natural resources, the inhabitants of this world have no choice but to leave their home. They’ll accomplish this by using advanced long range spacecraft to journey to the nearest habitable world that will become their new home.


Still stubbornly divided after decades of fighting, the remaining world powers now engage in a final surge for dominance and self preservation as they race ahead to their objective. As time runs out, they now must make a hasty departure from their dying planet. In order to complete their mission, they must obtain the materials necessary to sustain themselves, maintain their spacecraft, and research the science required to navigate their way through the long and dangerous journey that awaits them. In an ironic twist, they may be forced to cooperate with one another while still protecting their own interests. Now the ultimate strategic gamble for survival will require you to be the first to arrive and claim the distant world TERRA PROXIMA...

Terra Proxima, by Bavarian Games, is a push-your-luck, resource management game that will keep you on the edge of your seat throughout gameplay! It’s intense enough to keep experienced gamers excited, but simple enough to be enjoyable regardless of a player’s skill-set! In Terra Proxima, players will travel to different Moons and Planets to gather necessary materials and research the science in order to continue their journey towards Terra Proxima at the center of the board. The first player to arrive on Terra Proxima is the winner of the game. Will you be able to get there first?

—description from the designer

Name: Pictionary Manía Junior
Description:
Pictionary Manía Junior is a fast-paced game for the kids in which a player must draw an object while doing another fun activity and his teammates must guess what does the picture mean.

Game Mechanics:
The drawing and the colors of the category cards indicate: (1) The way in which the artist will try to let the playmates guess the word or concept drawn, and (2) Which word on the card is to be drawn.

Category description:

     Normal game option.
     The world upside down: draw the object turned upside down.
     Opposite hand: draw with your opposite hand.
     Eyes that do not see: draw with the eyes covered.
     Musical drawings: while you draw, you must hum a song.
     On the limp: lift one of the two legs while you draw.


In addition, there are the "Everyone plays" special event boxes.

End of the game:
The game ends when a team reaches the "Winner's Circle" in the center of the board and manages to complete 3 of the 5 category tiles it contains.

—user summary (English)

Pictionary Mania Junior es un trepidante juego para niños en el que un jugador debe dibujar un objeto mientras hace algo divertido y sus compañeros tienen que intentar adivinar lo que significa el dibujo.

Mecánica de juego:
Los dibujos y colores de las tarjetas de categoría indican: (1) La manera cómo el dibujante tratará de que sus compañeros de juego adivinen la palabra o concepto dibujado, y (2) Qué palabra de la tarjeta toca dibujar.

Descripción de categorías:

     Opción de juego normal.
     El mundo al revés: dibujar el objeto al revés (por ejemplo, una casa con el tejado abajo y el suelo arriba).
     Mano contraria: dibujar con la mano contraria.
     Ojos que no ven: dibujar con los objetos cerrados.
     Dibujos musicales: mientras dibujas, debes tararear una canción.
     A la pata coja: levanta una de las dos piernas mientras dibujas.


Además, existen las casillas especiales de "Todos juegan".

Fin de la partida:
El juego finaliza cuando uno de los equipos llega al "Círculo del Ganador" en el centro del tablero y consigue completar 3 de las 5 fichas de categoría que contiene.

—user summary

Name: FAB: Dubno '41
Description:
Fifth installment in Rick Young’s Fast Action Battle Series. 
FAB turns East.

The time is set for Operation Barbarossa and the greatest tank battle of all times: more than 3.000 Soviet and nearly 700 German tanks and assault guns will clash in Soviet occupied Southern Poland. Known as the Battle of Brody-Dubno-Lutsk, that bloody triangle saw the direst straits of invading German forces in Barbarossa as they struggle for a week to repel the massive Soviet armored counterattacks to the flanks of the spearhead formed by Ewald Kleist's 1st Panzergruppe.

German invasion force was aimed towards Kyiv and the Kyiv Special Military District was the better armed and prepared of all Soviet Fronts stationed on the Westerns borders of the URSS, with a full array of Soviet Mechanized Corps, equipped with hundreds of the new brand tanks KV and T-34.
As the German player you control two powerful German armies: 6th and 1st Panzergruppe. The Soviet player will control the Northern flank of the Southwestern Front –formed by the 5th and 6th all arms armies. Blocks are mostly divisions with some regiments/brigades and German Kampfgruppen.

In DUBNO’41 you will see, with a minimum of new rules, the Soviet unpreparedness for war in June 1941 as they desperately struggled for defeating the German invaders. Soviets had a huge amount of low quality units with powerful but fragile armored forces against the Wehrmacht at its peak of quality and efficiency. Not a one-sided battle as someone could think about Operation Barbarossa but the Soviets could accomplish their mission and defeat or at least stop the invaders. The game includes assets for minor but powerful German units as the elite 652nd Panzerjaeger battalion or the scarce panzer grenadiers units fully equipped with armored carrier vehicles, heavy artillery, anti-tank units, the all-known 88’s cannons and more. Events include Soviet extra-hard KV and T-34 tanks, flamethrower tanks, air attacks, Soviet mechanical breakdowns and political officers and more…

German swiftness and tactical ability is opposed to Soviet mass and technological advantage. Weirdly not a single Stuka plane would arrive to help the German forces as Army Group South was not equipped with that type of aircraft. Soviet Air Force will fight one of its more desperate battles adding considerable strength to Soviet ground attacks. Will you pierce the Soviet lines and breakout towards Kyiv, or you would slow the German advance and counterattack successfully defeating the invaders?

-description from designer

Name: Fishhunter
Description:
A few anglers are trying to catch the best fish. But somehow your choice of place doesn't seem to be the best to reach the jumping fish.
Fill your fishing net with the best fish before your fellow players do!

Each player receives a game piece and a fishing net. The lake is placed in the center. 5 phases are played. First you draw 2 tiles from the bag. Then you can put one or both tiles back into the bag and draw again. However, this costs one tile from the net. This can be repeated as often as you like.

After that, one tile is placed in the lake based on its coordinates. The other tile is turned over and serves as a time unit. The time unit can also be exchanged in phase 4 for giving up a tile from the fishing net. â €â €

In phase 5, fishing takes place. For each time unit, you may take one step around the lake and cast your fishing rod. Reeling in does not cost a unit of time. You may only cast straight ahead, so you must stand at right angles to the fish. Then the start player marker is passed on and a new round begins. â €â €

In the 3-4 player game, you can save time units and use them later. If a player's net is full, the current round is still played to the end, followed by the scoring. You add up the points of the fish on the fishing net. Who is the best angler?

Name: Axis Mundi
Description:
Axis Mundi is a 3X (Expand, Exploit, Exterminate) mythological-space themed game, in which each player commands one of four worlds: Olympus, Takamagahara, Asgard and Kukultan.

The goal of each player is to become the AXIS MUNDI - the axis of the world - of the intelligent and primitive civilizations of the worlds that populate the galaxy. In this way they will be the hegemonic culture of the galaxy.

A game consists of twelve turns. The game ends at the end of the twelfth turn.

In each turn, each player may perform up to three consecutive actions.

Actions allow movement and combat, the occupation of planets, the exploitation and regeneration of their resources, the deployment of combat units, and the development of one's own civilization on occupied planets.

A player wins if he has more controlled planets than the rest of the players at the end of turn twelve.

—description from the designer (translated)

AXIS MUNDI es un juego de temática mitológico-espacial 3X (Expand, Exploit, Exterminate), en el que cada jugador dirige una de estos cuatro mundos: Olimpo, Takamagahara, Asgard y Kukultán.

El objetivo de cada jugador es convertirse en el AXIS MUNDI –el eje del mundo- de las civilizaciones inteligentes y primitivas de los mundos que pueblan la galaxia. De este modo serán la cultura hegemónica de la galaxia.

Una partida consta de doce turnos. La partida finaliza al concluir el turno doce.

En cada turno, cada jugador podrá llevar a cabo hasta tres acciones consecutivas.

Las acciones permiten el movimiento y combate, la ocupación de planetas, la explotación y regeneración de sus recursos, el despliegue de unidades de combate, y el desarrollo de la civilización propia en los planetas ocupados.

Un jugador gana si consigue más planetas controlados que el resto de jugadores al finalizar el turno doce.

—description from the designer

Name: Twisted Game Of War
Description:
A fun, fast-paced medieval game that will keep everyone on the edge of their seat to see who will be crowned victorious. The game was made to be great for road trips and to unexpectedly lose friendships along the way. Be ready for anything as y'all take charge at one another with various and unique cards..... while you are getting yelled at of course!

When playing:


     Everyone takes charge with their deck of cards.
     All players then dual at the same time.
     Depending on the cards players play, (The type of weapon or the type of armor) the outcome could give you up to four cards or even return them to their rightful owners.
     The last defending player standing will be crowned VICTORIOUS!


—description from the designer

Name: Kaiserreise Wilhelm II
Description:
This is a redux of a variant of the renaissance-era Game of Goose (1587) which was themed around the era of Kaiser Wilhelm II and created around the year 1888.

According to the German designer Gerald H Kuhlmann, this appeared to be aimed at appealing to supporters of the Hohenozollern dynasty as they transitioned to the reign of young ruler who took his Grandfather's place and inspired hope of generational change.

In this game, 2 to 7 players rely on dice results to move their pieces around a spiral track toward the middle. The player who arrives first receives the tokens placed there at the start. Along the way, special space actions lead to special events, payments or profits.

When that end is achieved each player receives the tokens on the space of the monarch which was their hidden choice at the start. If players have chosen the same the rewards are split evenly. Any unchosen monarch's tokens are then also distributed evenly.

After all of this, the player with the most tokens (money) wins.

—user summary

Name: Flames of War: Firestorm Campaign – Overlord
Description:
Firestorm Campaign – Overlord

This campaign is designed to be flowing where the Generals take command from Round 1 and through the supply and reinforcement build-up, make strategic decisions around capturing key ground, denying enemy exploitation routes or attempting sweeping flank attacks. A deliberate inclusion in this game is the full use of Warriors as additional firestorm units; both Allied and German. They can often be the key to an unlikely victory!

Generals have much to ponder, they have to:

     Consider how to manage build-up of Allied reinforcements given finite supply availability and congestion around beaches
     Placement of Mulberry Harbours
     Impact of channel storms experienced in Round 3
     Interdiction of German supply routes
     Exploitation
     And much more…


The campaign has two distinct phases:

     Phase 1. D-Day 6 June. Played as a series of ‘Hit the Beach’ and ‘Seize and Hold’ missions. These are described in the handbook and should be adapted to suit local situations. There are two options for the impact of these games on the main tournament or second phase.
     Phase 2. Main Tournament. Designed to be played over five rounds and each round comprises a week culminating in the fifth week post invasion from 7 June to 15 July.


The handbook contains all the special rules developed for this game including:

     Firestorm reinforcement for both sides
     Weather effects
     German scattered defenders
     Game flow
     Game charts
     Terrain effects
     Town and area defences
     Suggested tournament player packs


—description from the publisher

Name: Miraculum
Description:
Thousands of years ago, the Book of Eternity was placed on a bridge with four sacred guardians of white and black magic to defend the balance between the forces of good and evil.

The magic that emanates from the book has sparked an ambition among its guardians who now struggle to the death to reach it and be the holder of the power of the book.

Choose your side and help the guardians to take possession of the Miraculum, the Book of Eternity.

Miraculum is a quick game based on the throw of dice to be played in pairs (2x2) or in duel mode (1x1), where you will have to choose between defending white magic or black magic.

You and your opponents will fight to the death to be the new holder of the holy book, the Miraculum.

Each turn, you will have to combine the result of your dice to be able to cast spells to attack, protect, walk, push, trap, poison, heal, reverse position or even summon a werewolf against your enemies.

There are two ways to win the game:
- Killing all wizards of the opposite color by throwing them off the bridge; or
- Arriving and taking possession of the Book of Eternity, the Miraculum.

Name: DeckBones
Description:
The Whispers of Qaeos & Classic Solitaire"The kingdoms of The Gar worked peaceably together for thousands of years, building trade, prosperity and respect ... then came Qaeos, the Dragon Queen.

Qaeos and her minions ravished the land, plundered its resources and enslaved its people, aided by allies within the ranks of the kingdoms themselves.

You have three days to outwit the forces of Qaeos, free the royals, nobles and subjects of the kingdoms, restore order, and collect your reward."

Klondike Solitaire - Unplugged

				
				
					GO OFFLINE
     Step away from your phone
     Close your laptop
     Walk away from your desktop
     Ignore alerts & messages
     Tune out and dive in


DeckBones let you play classic solitaire (and other card games) offline using LESS SPACE than a full-sized deck of cards, with LESS FIDDLING, flipping and aligning of slippery card stacks.


     NEW lore
     FUN gameplay variants
     UNIQUE Insurrection expansion


				
				
					FEATURES
     Available in NANO tiles (3/4″ x 1/2″)(19mm x 12mm) or MICRO tiles (1-1/8″ x 3/4″) (28mm x 19mm)
     Ergonomic ‘bone’ shape — easy to pick up, manouver and manipulate
     Play card games in extremely tight spaces
     Use anywhere — coffee shop, lap desk, brief case
     Pocket-sized, light-weight


—description from the designer

Name: Detective: City of Angels – Cloak & Daggered
Description:
In the first Single Case Pack expansion for Detective: City of Angels, you’ll solve a new case designed by Lara Wright (Kingdom Rush, Legend of Korra) and illustrated by Roland MacDonald (Undaunted: Normandy).

In this thrilling stand-alone case for Van Ryder Games’ award winning Detective: City of Angels, players must solve a diabolical mystery involving Russian spies and shadowy G-Men. Did Jack Sonin die of natural causes, or are there more nefarious agents behind his untimely demise?
Families: Game: Detective – City of Angels (Van Ryder Games)

Name: Profi-Fussball
Description: Players create and manage a soccer team by moving on a track wich provides events, opportunities to buy team members and challenges with other players. Money is the essential ressource you can gain or lose according to the events. Team members may be sold by negotiation from player to player. The Player to collect all of his 11 team members and owning the most valuable Team, wins the game.

Name: Fussball-Match Ein Fußballspiel für Heimkicker
Description:
A Soccer game for 2 or 4 players. 4 players play simultaneously two 2 player games on both identical boards.

A soccer match is played by rolling one die and moving one of the 11 pawns on the tracks, eliminating the opponent pawns by requiring the same field and moving one own pawn into the opponents goal. After scoring a goal, the game is reset, every player regains his lost pawns. Play continues until the agreed time is up.

Name: Little Bus Lotto
Description:
This animal-themed lotto game features 24 animal character tiles and 4 different colored buses to choose from.

The 24 tiles are spread out face down on the table. Each bus has pictures of 6 animals riding in them. Players select a tile and try to match it to one of their pictures. If the pictures don't match, the tile is returned upside down to the table. The first player to match  all his bus passengers, wins.

Whilst developing matching and memory skills, children will also love looking at the different animal characters and seeing what they are up to on the bus! This travel size game is for 2 - 4 players and suitable for ages 3 - 6 years.

Name: Hot Sand, Cold Steel: The Battle of Abu Ageila June 5-6, 1967
Description:
"Toward ten o'clock I could sense an added nervousness. Commanders asked more often
Whether there were any changes." –Yael Dayan’s comments following a command meeting by Sharon and his officers early in the attack at Abu Ageila, June 5, 1967.

Hot Sand, Cold Steel is an introductory-level wargame simulation of the battle of Abu Ageila, fought in the Sinai between the Egyptian 2nd Infantry Division and elements of General Ariel Sharon’s armored Ugdah (division).

Players are cast in the roles of the local commanders on this battlefield.  Both will be challenged to do as well, or better than their historical counterparts.

Each copy of Hot Sand, Cold Steel includes the following:

•    Eighty single-sided, unmounted counters
•    Two 11 by 17 inch hex map sheets
•    One Players’ Aid Sheet
•    8 pages of rules

Players will also need one six-sided die to play the game. Each hex is about three quarters of a kilometer across.  A turn represents two hours of time.  Each unit is either a battalion (II) or company (I).

Hot Sand, Cold Steel is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and features graphics by Tim Allen.

-description from designer

Name: Hansa Teutonica: Bonus Markers
Description:
Six new bonus markers for Hansa Teutonica (and the Big Box), adding more variety to the game.

Includes a correction sticker for the 1st print run (HT551482008DES) of the Britannia Game Board 4-5.

Part of the Pegasus CONspiracy Goodie Bag 2021. Also contained in spielbox 2021/2 (both English and German edition).

Name: Wizards and Blades
Description:
An obscure fantasy adventure boardgame independently published by the designer in the 1980's.

Three players control groups of warriors seeking to plunder the treasure cavern of the "Board Master," a fourth player. Each group of warriors competes against the other groups in an attempt to steal the Board Master's treasure.

A warrior player wins by carrying the Board Master's treasure to a designated sanctuary space. The Board Master's goal is to eliminate all of the warriors. At the Board Master's disposal are three wizards, six trolls, a Golden Guardian, and an Angel of Death! Each warrior player controls four warriors. The various playing pieces are plastic figurines.

At heart, Wizards and Blades is a traditional roll-and-move style game with events and flavor provided through cards. Combat between pieces can be resolved through dice rolling or card play.

—user summary

Name: Sushi Do
Description: Players offer trades by crying out the number of cards they want to swap (“One! One! One!”, or “Three! Three! Three!”) but not their sushi flavor. The winner of the hand is the first to collect all of one flavor (6 cards), declaring “Sushi Do!”. The winner of the hand scores points equal to the value of the flavor, and the winner of the game is the first to 500 points.

Name: Suits & Daggers
Description:
Players are assigned secret Statuses at the beginning of the game, deeming them either an Employee or Influencer. Influencers can deflect Sabotages and add bonus points to Collaboration, but using either power exposes their Status and Status cards are shuffled and redealt.

To earn points, players complete their assigned Objective cards by gathering the necessary Work cards into their hand. Without the right cards, players can still try to earn points by either “Slacking” (bluffing about having the right cards), or by collaborating with other players to complete Objectives-- selecting a partner who claims to have the cards you need and pooling resources to fulfill your objective.

Watch out though-- collaborating with the wrong player might mean getting Sabotaged (when your partner gives you any card(s) other than what you need), but collaborating with the right player (specifically, an Influencer) leads to seven (7) additional bonus points for the completed objective.

Some Work cards are also Undercut cards-- attacks that players can use against their peers. Players can use up to two Undercuts on other players at the end of their turn.

Sabotaging an Influencer by accident results in losing points, so be careful who you target! Regular Employees can also block Undercuts if they have an elusive Water Cooler card in hand at the time of an attempted attack.

-description from publisher

Name: La Famiglia
Description:
May 20, 1929—It’s the Roaring Twenties! The economy is booming, and new technologies such as the automobile and electricity are now mainstream. Alcohol is still flowing freely, even though Prohibition has banned its consumption. As a result, the mafia’s profits have been soaring from sales of their illegal bootleg liquor, and violent crime is also on the rise.

Al Capone, Chicago’s infamous mafia boss, was just arrested, but there’s more to the story. You receive a request for help from the FBI for their investigation into a gang called La Famiglia who might be even more dangerous than Capone’s Chicago Outfit gang. Can you crack the case?

La Famiglia contains one full storyline made up of two parts, with dozens of clues to crack and riddles to solve. Play with a group or on your own for hours of fun. It's like two escape room or mystery games with one single purchase.

Name: Jolly Tumbler
Description: A victorian game of skill.  Players try to roll their oblong tumbler into the hole for the highest points without losing it off the board.

Name: Emojito Party!
Description:
Emojito Party! provides big emotions in a practical travel format. As in the classic game EMOJITO!, players have to express emotions that are specified on the game cards: the bored, arrogant cat, the nasty fish or the frenetic, overwound alarm clock. You think that's easy? Then play Emojito Party and find out how well you are able to realize and recognize emotions. You can play Emojito Party! as an independent game, or add its cards as a complement to the classic party game EMOJITO!. Give your emotions free rein!

—description by the publisher

Name: Pixie
Description: A dexterity game where players throw marbles and try to be the first to 10,000 points.

Name: Tenable
Description:
Based on ITV's "Top 10" quiz Tenable, this board game brings you a fun and challenging adaptation of the TV show featuring questions and gameplay that will make you fill like you're taking part in the studio.

A team of players attempt to earn money by correctly guessing items in a list of ten.

The chosen team captain selects a teammate to answer the question for each round, and then play the final question themselves. In each round, one chosen player tries to give as many correct answers as they can for a category with ten items. Each answer earns money, and a player may stop and bank what they have at five correct answers. Banked money goes into the final jackpot for the bonus round.

To help, a team gets one life per round (in case they give a wrong answer), as well as one “Overrule”, where the team captain can reject a given answer and substitute another one. These can be used once per round, with the Overrule only allowed prior to five correct answers. The final help is three “Nominate” tokens, which are used among all players. With them, the player may chose another player to give an answer if they can’t think of one. Players get eliminated if they give a second wrong answer and are sent to the Vortex.

When all players have played a question, the final round begins. Any player who banked money and was not eliminated participates. If no player remained in the game, 500 is put into the bank and the captain plays solo. The team is given a choice of two lists to play, and they begin giving answers one at a time, in turn. A wrong answer eliminates a player. If the tenth answer is given, any remaining players split the money. If everyone is eliminated prior to getting all ten answers, the player who banked the most money in the previous rounds wins.

Name: Game of Spin'em
Description: Players set a top spinning in the center of the board. If the top starts a spinner to move, player scores the points shown.  Player with the highest total wins.

Name: Phrase Maze
Description:
Players try to exit the maze board by answering clue cards that have rhyming answers. There are four categories available for play: Their Flair (People), Sports Shorts (Sports), Creature Feature (Animal) and Hodge Podge (Variety). Each card contains four numbered clues which determine how far a playing piece may move (e.g. - answering clue #3 means a player can move three spaces). There are three sub-categories in the game: Think Wink, Thinky Winky and Thinkety Winkety. These designate two-word answers of one, two or three syllables per word, respectively. However, since Thinkety Winkety cards are harder, they are treated as Wild cards that allow for moving five spaces on the board.

When a player gives an answer, opponents may either pass or challenge the answer. While there is one answer per clue, it is possible to have more than one correct answer. If a player passes, they accept the given answer. If they challenge, they consult the Challenge Card and check the answer given. If the answers don’t match, it’s an automatic wrong answer. Once a team is correct, they can move their piece the number of spaces the clue stated, or they may hinder opponents by moving their piece farther from the exit. Moves are also not limited to completely one direction. For example, a move of three could be played as two backwards and one to the left.

The first player or team to get their piece to the exit on the opposite side where they started, wins the game.

Name: Party Freud
Description:
A new card game for people who probably need therapy and who love to laugh. (Ahem, everyone!)

Take turns playing "Doc" as players prescribe and treat some modern day ailments with comical solutions. Strengthen your funny bones and see who's the best at helping one another get through life.

The dealer (AKA the “Doc”) starts by dealing each player seven Freud cards. The Doc then draws a Party card and reads it aloud. The Party card will present a modern day ailment.

Players then choose from a range of fake treatment options through the Freud cards and toss them into a pile. The Doc then reads the fake treatment options aloud and chooses their favorite prescription. Plus, our Group Therapy prompts are hidden within the Party cards.

Group Therapy activities include:

     Symptom Charades: Using the rules of charades, players act out a range of mood related ailments.
     Rapid Response: Similar to categories, players shout out words to fit within a certain category.
     Diagnose a Friend: Players identify who amongst the group fits a certain description.
     Head Talk: The Doc places a card on their for head and players shout out clues as fast as possible to compete for the most helpful assistant. 


—description from the designer

Name: The Soft-Core Pornography Game
Description:
Two teams of two players each try to match answers to personal questions, with matching answers given the the opportunity to choose a “Lewd Language” card to place on their game board. Each board contains a phrase with blanks in it numbered 1-6. The blanks filled in after each question are determined by the number printed on the card. Each card also has a point value on it, with more points given for dirtier words.

In lieu of drawing a new card, players may also choose to trade a card they already have for a new one. They do this in the hopes of getting a higher point value on their card. There are also Censored and Socially Redeeming Cards in each deck. Censored cards are used to cover one of the opponent’s words, thereby blocking out scoring points, and the Socially Redeeming cards are used to remove a Censored card if one has been placed.

The player or team who creates the highest scoring sentence on their game card wins.

Name: Quests: Heroes of Sorcado
Description:
Quests: Heroes of Sorcado is an epic  fantasy cooperative campaign for 1-6 players.  In each of eight adventures (plus a bonus training adventure) you'll  build your character, acquiring powerful spells and weapons, and increasing your abilities by defeating monsters, evading traps, and forging your path through choice-driven events, traps, and side quests.

Add up your Hero's character, weapon, and magic bonuses, and roll dice for damage against fearsome foes, with each Adventure culminating in a boss fight that will require all your best items, potions, abilities, and a bit of luck.  With a 60+ page campaign story and 140+ pages of additional story events and choices, players can immerse themselves in a world beset by a demon lord bent on total destruction.  Choose your destiny, hone your weapons, and find out if you have what it takes to save Sorcado from utter destruction at the hands of the Dark Lord.

				
				
					-=-=-=-You can try the Demo/Prequel adventure on TableTop Simulator : https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2435363148

Name: Munchkin Collectible Card Game: Tardigrade Wanderer Promo Card
Description:
Munchkin CCG TCG Tardigrade Wanderer Promo DeSouza Art Free RPG Day Exclusive.

Hero Card.

DESCRIPTION:
Zap – Move 1 card from your discard pile to the bottom of your deck.

Name: Machu Picchu Mystery
Description: Explore the ancient Inca city of Machu Picchu in search of the lost tomb of emperor Pachacuti in this at-home escape room.

Name: Washington DC Mystery
Description: Explore the city of Washington DC, exploring the nation's monuments and museum as you track down a secret society and stop their evil plans in this at-home escape room.

Name: Freeform Skirmish Referee
Description:
Freeform Skirmish Referee is a wargame where two or more players are in control of a force of combat focused units.

The players give the orders for their units to an adjudicating referee who interprets the outcomes of these orders in the game world.

The referee then presents these outcomes to the players.

It is different from most wargames in that the players do not need to know any of the rules of the game (in fact there are none - the entire game depends on the adjudication of the referee).

The players simply need to know what type of fighting force they would like to play and to tell the adjudicating referee the actions they would like that force to take.

Guidelines are presented in this PDF for running the game, creating units, providing orders and adjudicating turns.

Additionally, d6 tables for action resolution and a page of sample units are provided.

—description from the publisher

Name: Belote Junior
Description:
Discover the famous belote games in its Junior version!

     With 4 game rules to learn Belote and its variants!
     Let your children discover the games of your childhood!
     From 6 years old. From 2 to 6 players.

Name: New Phone, Who Dis?: First Expansion Pack
Description:
This expansion pack is full of ridiculous new Inbox + Reply Cards to add to New Phone, Who Dis? Core Game.

Players rotate drawing a sent (or “inbox”) card while the rest of the group competes to play the funniest “reply” card. Once everyone has played their chosen reply card, the rotating judge awards a point to the funniest one. The player with the most points at the end of the round takes the crown.

Includes 45 Inbox cards and 135 reply cards to be added to the main game.

Name: Pictures: XL Fotos
Description:
Contains 96 large cards (111 x 79 mm):
• 91 cards with the 182 photos of the original game
• 4 cards with 8 photos themed on games
• 1 card with a variant for experienced players
The photos are over 60% larger by their surface.

Note: A copy of the base game is required as this is only cards and does not come with the other components necessary for play.

Name: Show Me The Monet
Description:
Think Go Fish, with a classical art theme and deeper strategy.

To start the game, players are dealt four cards face down. The remaining cards are placed face down into a draw pile. On a player's turn, they ask another player if they have an artist card (e.g do you have a piece by Van Gogh?). The player they're asking then has two options. They can either say yes and give the other player their Van Gogh cards, or say no, either truthfully or in an attempt to bluff.  As this game involves bluffing, if a player does not believe their opponent is telling the truth when they say they do not have a card by the named artist, they can challenge their opponent. If their opponent did have any cards by the named artist, the opponent loses a turn and has to give all cards by the named artist to the person who challenged them, and the person who challenged them takes another turn. If the challenge fails, the person who made the challenge must give the person they challenged all their cards by the named artist and the turn then passes to the left.

When a player builds a complete collection (four cards by the same artist, by artists from the same country, in the same genre, or by female artists), they place those cards on the table face up, these cards form your collection. If when doing this a player runs out of cards in their hand, they draw four new cards from the draw pile. Play continues until the draw pile is empty and all cards are placed into collections, or no more collections can be formed from the cards left in player's hands.

At the end of the game, players add up the value of their collection, taking into account any end game and wild card bonuses. The player who has the most expensive collection wins the game.
Families: Theme: Fine Art and Art Museums

Name: Dreidel Roulette
Description:
On a player's turn, they spin the dreidel on the playing board containing 12 wood balls and 16 holes worth between 1-100 points. A player scores points according to the holes they knock the balls into, losing points for knocking balls out of the playing area.

The game consists of 3 rounds, with each round consisting of every player getting 1 turn. Whoever has the most points after those 3 rounds wins.

With the balls and colors both having one of three colors, there are many variants, including getting bonus points for matching certain color balls with their holes in each round.

Name: Cargo From Fargo
Description:
It's a race across the country as you pilot your cargo plane, earning points as you make your deliveries. Pick your routes to be the quickest and most efficient.

There are two types of cards in the game. Route cards show a potential cargo delivery route, displaying a PICKUP AIRPORT and a DELIVERY AIRPORT, and also the point value of the route once completed. Action cards can be either GREEN - which benefit the player playing the card and RED - which negatively affect an opponent who receives the card.

Play begins with a number of unclaimed route cards equal to the number of players plus three. These are available to all players.

On their turn, the player does two things. First is the movement phase, where the player rolls the dice and moves their airplane token. Airport spaces must be avoided unless the player intends on "landing" there. Once on an airport space, that player claims an associated route card with that airport as the PICKUP AIRPORT. The goal is now to complete that Route card as quickly as possible by moving on subsequent turns to the DESTINATION AIRPORT indicated on the claimed card. Once the DESTINATION AIRPORT is landed on, the player claims the associated points and now may chase another route to gain more points.

The second part of one's turn is comprised of playing one action card if the payer chooses to. Follow the card (either GREEN or RED) instructions. Then play moves to the next person in a clockwise direction.

First player to earn 20 points is the winner.

Name: Ziiip
Description:
Players play cards from their hand (3 cards in each category).
Cards are divided in 4 categories:

     SERVICE 
     RECEP-DEF
     ATTACK
     STAR 


Gameplay:
Player A plays a card (indicating a number of dice to roll and some bonus) and player B tries to match it, until it one wins the point.
i.e. player A plays a "Service" card, player B has to match it (with a roll Recep/defense card), if B doesn't, A scores a point. If B matches. 
If B does match it (or better), then B can play an attack card that now has to be matched by A...

This goes on for every point until one of the player reaches the required winning points.

Name: Imperial Settlers: Empires of the North – Secret Cabal 2020 Promo Pack
Description:
Promo pack of five new cards released for "The Secret Cabal Gaming Podcast is at Full Froth in 2020!" Kickstarter campaign.

Unconfirmed: They are added to the side and first come, first serve.

Gloomshroom Cave
Troll's Pantry
Lost in the Mine
Dungeon
Styx Power

Name: Il gioco del contrabbandiere
Description:
Il gioco del contrabbandiere, the Smuggler's Game.

The protagonists of this game are the "financiers" (finanza) and smugglers (contrabbandiere) who, especially from the 50s to the 70s have marked the history, economy and culture of the Como and Ticino area in Lombardy, Italy and Switzerland.

The Smugglers get 3 pawns, the financier brigadier 3 as well. Movements are from 1 point to another.

The Smugglers win if two of them reach a Warehouse on the Italian side.
The Financiers win by catching two Smugglers.

In this game there are no dice, this gives ample space to strategy. In addition there are "event" cards to make sure that everything can change until the last move.

Name: Vertellis Family Edition: Parents & Kids
Description:
Everyday - "Life"

In our “always-on” society, the pressure on parents and children is higher than ever. Every family has their moments such as moving, new careers, and general relationship challenges. Each of these can cause a breakdown in communication and a feeling of being misunderstood.

How it works?

In a playful way, you will answer fun and serious questions that are important to a family. Every family member will feel which lowers the bar for improved communication not only during our fun games but outside of it too! Above all, this is a fun and amazing question card game to learn from each other.

What happens?

This game is for anyone who lives at home or is part of a family. As the year progresses, your answers to the questions can change. Therefore, we recommend using them more than once a year. Happy Families who are already close will find that their bonds improve even further.

The game

The game is played in four rounds. Rounds 1 and 3 have individual questions while rounds 2 and 4 are a mix of questions and assignments designed to get everyone involved and working together. Two sample questions are: If you could create a new tradition within your family, what would it be? What has been a recent happy memory with your parents?

With the Vertellis Family Edition, everyone will get their turn in the conversation.
    The conversation card game will result in fun and important conversations between family members.
    This is one of the family games for adults and kids from all backgrounds.
    One of the greatest family games for more time together and offline
    The Family Edition is one of the unique gifts that will create enriching conversations
    The questions are particularly suited for fun games between parents and children
    You will spend more time offline with these questions and family games for kids and adults
    Family Editions are fun games bringing together the whole family

Name: Mythbond: Don't Wake the Monsters
Description:
Various adventurers throw themselves into dangerous dens of monsters. The vile monsters are guarding numerous gold coins and treasures, the humans are no match of them – but luckily the monsters get dizzy and fall asleep! Dear adventurers, you must be very quiet when picking up treasures, and remember the other players are not your true friends!

Players use action cards to pick up treasure cards on a map built up with unused monster cards. During planning phrase, players choose (aka plan) action cards face down from his hand. Planned action cards are resolved during resolve phrase according to the speed factor on them. Also, different action cards will cause different level of noises, which accumulates and maybe loud enough to wake the monster:

Dizzy-waken monster will attack the direction (and all characters there) it is facing
Angry-waken monster will attack the direction (and all characters there) where it is the nosiest
Monster attacks will cause affected characters drop a lot of treasures they previously got!

Treasure cards after being picked up go to that player’s bag, so do the action cards after used. Later when you replenish your hand from the bag, you got the some unable-to-use-as-action treasure cards instead of action cards. But you can choose THROW A TREASURE at another player to make some huge noise there! Of course you can choose to put a too-valuable-to-give-up treasure back into your bag…

The monster will eventually fully wake and players will evacuate from the den. The player with the highest total value of treasure wins the game!

Name: La Baraja Mutante
Description:
In a remote place there is a Pyramid that hides in its interior a Dazzling Treasure. Four Peoples embarked, a long time ago, on their search. The People of the Valley, the People of the Forest, the People of the Mountain, and the People of Space. Four lonely heroes, bored of being so lonely, decided to join the quest: the skeleton, the robot, the barbarian and the mermaid.
Thus was born the authentic and original... Mutant Deck I

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Halfling Team Card Pack
Description:
Redesigned for the Second Season Edition ruleset, this deck of 44 cards will help you keep track of stats and profiles for your team, positions, and Star Players – plus Special Play cards exclusively for use with Halfling teams.

CONTENTS
– 4x Player Reference cards for Halfling Catchers, Halfling Hopeful Linemen, Halfling Hefties, and Altern Forest Treemen
– 4x Star Player cards, including Deeproot Strongbranch, Grak, Crumbleberry, and Rumbelow Sheepskin
– 16x Special Play cards exclusive to Halfling teams, 8x Random Events and 8x Miscellaneous Mayhem
– 19x Blank Player cards: 13x Halfling Hopeful Lineman, 2x Halfling Catcher, 2x Halfling Hefty, and 2x Altern Forest Treeman
– The all-important card explaining how to use the cards, with a red card on the reverse

You'll need a copy of Blood Bowl: the Official Rules to make full use of these cards.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Black Orc Team Card Pack
Description:
This deck contains 44 cards to help you keep track of stats and profiles for your team, positions, and Star Players – plus Special Play cards exclusively for use with Black Orc teams. They come packaged in a flip-top card box for safe travels.

This set includes:
– 3 Player Reference cards for Goblin Bruiser, Black Orc, and Trained Troll
– 3 Star Player cards for Varag Ghoul-Chewer, the Black Gobbo, and Morg 'n' Thorg
– 8 Random Events Special Play cards
– 8 Benefits of Training Special Play cards
– 21 Blank Player cards: 14x Goblin Bruiser, 6x Black Orc, and 1x Trained Troll
– The all-important card explaining how to use the cards, with a red card on the reverse

You'll need a copy of Blood Bowl – The Official Rules to make full use of these cards.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Imperial Nobility Team Card Pack
Description:
This deck contains 44 cards to help you keep track of stats and profiles for your team, positions, and Star Players – plus Special Play cards exclusively for use with Imperial Nobility teams. They come packaged in a flip-top card box for safe travels.

This set includes:
– 5 Player Reference cards for Imperial Retainer Lineman, Imperial Thrower, Noble Blitzer, Bodyguard, and Ogre
– 5 Star Player cards for Griff Oberwald, Helmut Wulf, Karla Von Kill, Mighty Zug, and Morg 'n' Thorg
– 8 Heroic Feats Special Play cards
– 8 Magical Memorabilia Special Play cards
– 17 Blank Player cards: 8x Imperial Retainer Lineman, 2x Imperial Thrower, 2x Noble Blitzer, 4x Bodyguard, and 1x Ogre
– The all-important card explaining how to use the cards, with a red card on the reverse

You'll need a copy of Blood Bowl – The Official Rules to make full use of these cards.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Death Zone
Description:
Blood Bowl is a sprawling and chaotic game, played in many different ways across the world. Whether it's playing a quick game of Sevens, hiring unscrupulous mercenary players to help you score an easy win, or venturing out in conditions that could hardly be called ideal, this variety makes for no dull moments in a game that's already known for ferocious action.

The Death Zone supplement includes a wide array of additional rules designed to pack even more excitement, tension, and action into your games. Explore the world of Blood Bowl in more depth, employ new inducements, add mercenary players, and play half-sized games for faster, more frantic gameplay.

This 104-page hardback book includes new ways to enjoy your games of Blood Bowl, plus expanded background material and a variety of thrilling options for every team.

- Explore the world of Blood Bowl in greater detail than ever before.

- A wealth of fresh Inducements – convince a wide array of Wizards, coaching staff, and bribed referees to help you clinch victory.

- Hire mercenary players – skilled athletes who are happy to get the job done for any coach with coin.

- Alternative weather tables represent extreme locations like tropical forests, arctic tundra, and subterranean caverns.

- Details on how to play Sevens – a fast and frantic version of Blood Bowl, played on a smaller pitch, with fewer players. It’s a great way to squeeze in a quick game or try out some new plays.

You'll need a copy of Blood Bowl – The Official Rules to make full use of this supplement.

-description from publisher's website

Name: KPOP: Becoming an Idol
Description:
Calling all K-Pop Fans! You’ve always been in the audience supporting your favorite idols, but now it’s time for YOU to step up onto the stage.

KPOP: Becoming an Idol is a unique and exciting board game where you get the chance to experience life as a K-Pop Trainee. As you travel around the board, you’ll use Story Cards to improve your skills in Dance, Vocal and Rap, visit Clothing Stores and Salons to put together the perfect look, and show off your new skills to the world to start building up your Fanbase.

Once you’ve acquired enough fans to earn a coveted Evaluation Token, you’ll head to the center of the board to face the judge who will test your skills to their limits...and if you’re the first to impress them, you’ll become the next great K-Pop Idol!

—description from the publisher

Name: Efteraber: Copy the monkey
Description:
In this game, we will become adorable little monkeys who like to move non-stop.

The players will take a card from the deck and imitate the movement indicated on it. The next player will draw a new card and must imitate both the previous movement and the new one that he has chosen. Each player must repeat all the previous movements in the same order.

If a player forgets a move or does them in the wrong order, they are eliminated from the game.  The last person standing wins.

There are 32 cards with 8 different types of monkeys.

Name: Hot Pot Hustle!
Description:
Tonight, the Immortals get together to feast on their favorite dish, hot pot. But, despite their shared love for hot pot, they don’t care for each other one bit!

In Hot Pot Hustle! Each player takes the role of a mythical creature from the traditional Chinese mythology, an Immortal, whose goal is to have the best and most delicious hot pot dinner whilst sabotaging the other Immortals their meal! Each Immortal character has a favorite type of food, as well as one they despise. Each player tries to eat as much as possible of their Immortal’s favorite food, while tricking the other players into eating food they despise and ruining their meal. A variety of tricks, traps and deceits are available to make the dinner go according to your wishes. Steal food from other players, switch up ingredients or outright threaten the other Immortals: everything is fair game in Hot Pot Hustle!

In Hot Pot Hustle! Players take turns flipping cards from a deck of cards called “The Pot.” Each card has a chili spiciness level assigned to it with a value between 0 and 6. Players must take care not to go over a chili level of 6, or they have to dispose of all the flipped cards. After this, the Immortal proceeds to eat the food cards and you place them in sets of different types of food. There are a total of 6 types of food (meat, fish, vegetables, tofu, mushrooms and noodles) and each food set has to be up of different food types up to a total of 4 cards per set.

Each player’s Immortal character has a favorite food type indicated on the character card: for this food type, you can place as many as you want in one food set, up to the 4 card set maximum. However, the character card also shows what food your Immortal hates: these food cards are thrashed and scored as minus points at the end of the game.

In addition to the food cards there are Trick & Trap cards that allow the player to alter the game in their favor and sabotage other players.

At the end of the game, players score points for each food set they have created, and they get minus points for food they disliked and put in the trash.

—description from the designer

Name: Catacombs (Third Edition): Weapon Cache Expansion
Description:
Originally available as part of Pack A from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

A small 7 card expansion for Catacombs: Third Edition that adds more weapon item cards to the game.

Name: This That & Everything: Popular Culture
Description:
Looking for a fast-paced, easy to learn, crowd-pleasing game? This That & Everything: Popular Culture is about all things related to the entirety of ideas, perspectives, attitudes, images, and other phenomena that is considered popular.

In this rapid-fire game, players race to describe people, places, and things related to pop culture for their teammates to guess. Doesn't sound like much of a challenge? Try to describe all 6 in 30 seconds!

Contents: 100 Double-Sided Cards, Score Pad, 30-Second Sand Timer

Name: Order & Entropy: Tactical Deckbuilder
Description:
Order & Entropy is a competitive 2-4 player science-fantasy card game with immersive strategy, an elaborate art style, and remarkable replay value.

The theme of the game takes influence from our own style of science-fantasy, sociology, philosophy, and psychology.

To win the game, you can eliminate your adversaries or have the most Wisdom Points by the end of the game.

Players can eliminate each other by reducing their opponent's Consciousness Deck and Subconscious Pile to zero using Altric cards to attack them during the game.

At the end of the game, players will count all the Wisdom points on all the cards on their play mat minus their Forgotten Pile and any Banished cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Muskets & Tomahawks: Shakos & Bayonets
Description: Shakos & Bayonets is the supplement for Muskets & Tomahawks, dealing with the Napoleonic period.
